description:
A cross-platform IDE for C and C++

A powerful IDE from JetBrains helps you develop in C and C++ on Linux, macOS and Windows.
CLion 2024.3 is now available and offers a range of new features for CLion Nova, embedded development, and debugging.
The highlights include:
- The IDE frontend and backend improvements have significantly reduced CLion Nova’s memory footprint, which is particularly evident when handling large projects like Chromium ones.
- CLion Nova now includes function call hierarchy support.
- The Debug Servers configuration option helps you streamline the process of configuring debugging for embedded and remote development.
- With the OpenCV image viewer, you can now view a two-dimensional OpenCV array as an image while debugging.
- You can now attach the debugger to an unstarted process, which is helpful when you need to debug an executable launched by a third-party program or a script.
- The enhanced JetBrains AI Assistant plugin, featuring our internally trained LLM for C++, has significantly improved the speed and intelligence of CLion’s cloud code completion.
- Project status notifications have been moved from the editor to the new project status widget and are now less distracting.
- We’ve improved the onboarding tips so that you can try out some of CLion’s key features and get a clearer picture of its capabilities right from the start.
- The following bundles have been updated: GDB to 15.2, LLDB to 19.1.3, CMake to 3.30.5, and Ninja to 1.12.1.
To learn more about all the features of CLion 2024.3, read our blog post.
Please share your feedback and report any issues to our issue tracker.
